5 Different Bermuda Triangles Games

Free! Dr. Scratchov Scratcher!

disposable games to scratch, play & throw away

OBJECTIVE: An invasion of UFOs is hovering over the Bermuda Triangle. You operate a series of Coast Guard Rescue Stations located just outside the area.

YOUR MISSION: pilot rescue choppers into the dangerous Triangle in search of human survivors. But don't let the UFOs zap you out of the Solar System.

HOW TO PLAY (solo version): You have enough choppers for six rescue flights. Start each mission by scratching the triangle in front of any rescue station, indicated by a black dot along the sides of the large triangle. From there, fly in any direction by scratching any triangle that is next to the space you currently occupy.
 
Continue flying through the triangles in search of human ships. You can move one space at a time, in any direction you desire. Some spaces will be empty, but others will reveal the following:
 DINGY - 1 person aboard

ROWBOAT - 3 people aboard

YACHT - 7 people aboard

CLIPPER - 10 people aboard

UFO - Zap! A UFO abducts you and all your passengers back to Andromeda to work as slaves in a pyramid factory. This ends that mission and you score no points. There are about half a dozen UFOs hiding in the triangles, mostly near the outside edge.

RADAR - Radar indicates that a ship larger than a dingy lies in the direction shown within four spaces.
MISSION - Uncovering an "M" give you fuel for an extra mission, if you can return safely from your present one. If your are capture by a UFO before returning, you lose the extra mission and all the survivors on this trip.

To rescue survivors, you must get them out by flying off any side of the Triangle without running into a UFO. This ends the mission and allows you to score 1 point for each survivor you picked up. You can fly out of the Triangle right away, or take a chance searching for more survivors before heading out. Each mission must start from a new rescue station and, since you don't want to waste fuel searching an area twice, a new mission path cannot cross over an old one.

Rescue 50 or more humans to win the game.

TWO PLAYER VERSION - The game plays the same except that players take turns for 3 missions each. The player rescuing the most humans wins.

—user summary
